natural solution: First, we can rewrite the whole expression as $(5x+3) + [-2(2x-4)]$. Distributing the second part, we have $-2(2x-4) = -4x +8$.
Substituting this into our big expression, we have $(5x+3) + (-4x +8)$.
Combining like terms, we get $(5x - 4x) + (3 + 8)$. This yields $\boxed{x+11}$ or $\boxed{11+x}$.

fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 5 * x + 3"

and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x - Q x"
shows  "\<forall> x. R x = x + 11"

 Substituting this into our big expression, we have $(5x+3) + (-4x +8)$.
 Combining like terms, we get $(5x - 4x) + (3 + 8)$. This yields $\boxed{x+11}$ or $\boxed{11+x}$.
 *)

shows  "\<forall> x. R x = x + 11"
